page.title: 05Caravan Park
page.content: The caravan park is at the bottom of the town beside Carlingwark Loch. It is usually busy and last year there were 10162 tourists of which 209 were foreign. They have lots of facilities - there are toilets, laundries, showers, boats, tennis and a putting lawn. In the laundries there are plugs for things like hairdryers. The tennis and boats and putting can also be used by the public. Whether you are in a caravan or tent you get 6 metres square. You can't book a special place, you just get what is there. In the low season a place costs Â£3.10 but in high season it costs Â£4.00. In the high season Mr Kirkpatrick the warden has an assistant but usually during the year he works alone.
